assessments.task_title: Implement task quality assessment system

dimensions.name: completeness
dimensions.notes: Did the task achieve its stated goal?

dimensions.name: code_quality
dimensions.notes: Is the code clean, tested, maintainable?

dimensions.name: documentation
dimensions.notes: Was work properly documented?

dimensions.name: efficiency
dimensions.notes: Token usage, time efficiency

dimensions.name: impact
dimensions.notes: Did this improve the system significantly?

assessments.lessons_learned: Quality assessment system enables tracking task quality over time - use for continuous improvement

assessments.task_title: Migrate tools to use modern tool() helper pattern
assessments.lessons_learned: Modern tool() pattern with Zod provides better type safety and consistency with OpenCode core tools

assessments.task_title: Improve knowledge extraction to capture more insights
assessments.lessons_learned: Knowledge extraction benefits from stricter filtering with similarity checking to reduce noise

assessments.task_title: Implement memory context summarization for compaction
assessments.lessons_learned: Key decisions extraction needs better filtering to avoid generic event messages like 'Event: session.updated'

assessments.task_title: Improve key decisions extraction filtering in context-summarizer
assessments.lessons_learned: Regex patterns are effective for filtering out generic log messages - maintain exclude list as new patterns emerge

assessments.task_title: Create Playwright MCP server for browser automation
assessments.lessons_learned: MCP server implementation is straightforward with the SDK. The server manages browser state globally which works well for sequential operations but could be enhanced with session management for concurrent use. Type safety could be improved with proper typing for tool arguments.

assessments.task_title: Enhance agent coordination - support automatic task claiming
assessments.lessons_learned: Task claiming adds coordination but true automatic detection would require background processes. The message bus approach allows agents to poll for task_available messages. Consider adding a task_watch command for CLI monitoring.

assessments.task_title: Create advanced multi-agent coordination patterns
assessments.lessons_learned: Task dependencies enable complex workflow orchestration. The automatic unblocking mechanism reduces manual coordination. Worker pool patterns should be combined with proper cleanup for stale workers.

assessments.task_title: Enhanced dynamic system prompt with tasks and user messages
assessments.lessons_learned: Dynamic context injection is powerful for agent awareness. Keep injected context concise to avoid token waste. Prioritize important information (tasks, messages) over historical context.

assessments.task_title: Implement agent health checks and auto-recovery
assessments.lessons_learned: Health monitoring should be integrated early in multi-agent systems. The monitor includes auto-cleanup which prevents registry bloat from dead agents.

assessments.task_title: Add task prioritization and smart scheduling
assessments.lessons_learned: Priority aging prevents task starvation - even low priority tasks will eventually bubble up. Complexity scoring helps with workload estimation.

assessments.task_title: Create session summarization tool for knowledge extraction
assessments.lessons_learned: Session summarization extracts learnings from OpenCode's message/part storage. Key is to feed extracted insights back into knowledge base for continuous learning.

assessments.task_title: Implement automatic knowledge summarization and deduplication
assessments.lessons_learned: Knowledge deduplication requires both exact and fuzzy matching. Jaccard similarity on word sets works well for detecting near-duplicates. Always backup before destructive operations.

assessments.task_title: Create beautiful dashboard UI with shadcn and Vite
assessments.lessons_learned: Building dashboard UIs benefits from starting with WebSocket for real-time updates, falling back to HTTP polling. Modular components (Card, Badge, Panel) enable rapid iteration.

assessments.task_title: Create automated test suite for plugin tools
assessments.lessons_learned: Comprehensive test suite with proper isolation using beforeEach/afterEach for clean state. Integration tests verify full workflows.

assessments.task_title: Add session analytics dashboard page
assessments.lessons_learned: Building vanilla JS charts is straightforward with CSS flexbox. Horizontal bar charts work well for activity data. Always add file watchers for analytics data sources to enable real-time updates.

assessments.task_title: Add agent performance metrics tracking
assessments.lessons_learned: Agent performance metrics are best collected at key lifecycle events (task claim, task complete, quality assess) to minimize overhead. Storing metrics in a separate file from health checks keeps concerns separated.

assessments.task_title: Add shadcn/ui components to dashboard-ui
assessments.lessons_learned: Tailwind CSS v4 uses @theme directive instead of CSS custom properties with hsl(). shadcn/ui components work well with Tailwind v4 but require careful color configuration. ESLint react-refresh warnings for component files can be disabled in the ui folder.

assessments.task_title: Create OpenCode conversation tracking system
assessments.lessons_learned: OpenCode stores conversations in a structured format: sessions in /session/<project_hash>/, messages in /message/<session_id>/, and parts in /part/<message_id>/. Each is a JSON file with clear schema. The watch command uses fs.watch with recursive option for real-time monitoring.

assessments.task_title: Create session analytics and learning system
assessments.lessons_learned: Session analytics tool provides valuable insights into tool usage patterns, success rates, and common errors. Verified working with 100% session success rate. Integrates with knowledge base for persistent learning.

assessments.task_title: Implement task completion notifications
assessments.lessons_learned: Task completion notifications implemented with browser Notification API and Web Audio API for audio alerts. The dashboard server watches message-bus.jsonl for task_completed messages and broadcasts to WebSocket clients. Notification toggle in header allows users to enable/disable alerts. Integration with existing plugin task_update function ensures all task completions trigger notifications.

assessments.task_title: Implement agent collaboration patterns for complex tasks
assessments.lessons_learned: Multi-agent collaboration patterns are best documented with TypeScript examples showing message flow and state transitions. The checkpoint pattern is particularly valuable for long-running tasks that may be interrupted. Anti-patterns section helps prevent common mistakes.

assessments.task_title: Add plugin unit tests for edge cases and error handling
assessments.lessons_learned: Edge case tests help document actual system behavior vs expected behavior. Several tests revealed that corrupted JSON files return errors rather than graceful defaults - this is documented as future improvement area. Blocked tasks can still be claimed (manual override pattern). Missing dependencies don't block tasks (they're treated as already complete).

assessments.task_title: Create dashboard real-time connection status and auto-reconnect
assessments.lessons_learned: Exponential backoff should always have both minimum and maximum bounds. Using refs for WebSocket and timeout storage prevents closure issues in React effects.

assessments.task_title: Add WebSocket event streaming to dashboard server
assessments.lessons_learned: Event categorization pattern (categorizeEvent function) makes it easy to add new event types. STREAMABLE_EVENT_TYPES set provides clear enumeration of what gets streamed. Quality assessment detection requires tracking count, not just file change.

assessments.task_title: Implement agent session recovery system
assessments.lessons_learned: Recovery system needs to be used at task claim time to save checkpoints. The checkpoint data structure captures context well (what was happening, next steps, blockers). Fixed bug: generateCompactSummary was undefined - always test compaction hook. CLI recovery commands provide good visibility into session state.

assessments.task_title: Create plugin integration tests with real file operations
assessments.lessons_learned: Integration tests complement unit tests by testing actual file I/O, JSON corruption scenarios, and multi-tool workflows. Using isolated test directories prevents pollution between tests while still validating real filesystem behavior.

assessments.task_title: Implement message bus rotation and compaction
assessments.lessons_learned: Message bus management is critical for system health. Auto-maintenance during boot prevents unbounded growth. Archive + index pattern enables historical search while keeping active bus small.

assessments.task_title: Create working memory archival system
assessments.lessons_learned: Session parsing requires handling multiple header formats (Current/Previous/Earlier Session). Archiving significantly reduces context size while preserving full history. Index file enables fast archive discovery without reading all files.

assessments.task_title: Git integration for multi-agent memory system
assessments.lessons_learned: Git integration enables agents to track their code changes with metadata. The CLI/plugin split provides both programmatic and user-accessible interfaces. Activity logging enables historical analysis of agent git operations.

assessments.task_title: Add agent performance profiling and optimization suggestions
assessments.lessons_learned: Performance profiling requires analyzing multiple data sources (OpenCode parts, session logs, performance metrics, quality assessments). The key insight is to aggregate data from various sources and generate actionable suggestions rather than just reporting metrics.

assessments.task_title: Create live terminal dashboard with blessed/ink
assessments.lessons_learned: Canvas-based widgets in blessed-contrib require specific terminal width constraints. Text-based alternatives using blessed.box with ANSI formatting provide more reliable cross-terminal compatibility.

assessments.task_title: Implement tool execution time tracking in plugin hooks
assessments.lessons_learned: Using Map for in-memory state tracking of active tool calls allows efficient lookup without file I/O. The tool.execute.before hook captures start time while tool.execute.after calculates and logs timing - this pattern enables accurate duration measurement.

assessments.task_title: Create automated daily performance reports
assessments.lessons_learned: Daily reports provide valuable visibility into system health. Storing reports as markdown enables easy reading and archiving. Automatic suggestion generation based on metrics thresholds helps identify issues proactively.

assessments.task_title: Add per-agent conversation viewer to track message/tool streams
assessments.lessons_learned: Per-agent conversation tracking requires correlating multiple data sources (messages, tool timing, logs) by agent ID and session ID. The real-time stream feature with file watching provides good visibility into agent activity.

assessments.task_title: Create critique agent type for code review and debugging
assessments.lessons_learned: Pattern-based code analysis works well for common issues but can have false positives when patterns appear in string literals. Skill files provide good documentation for agent capabilities.

assessments.task_title: Add real-time performance metrics to dashboard-ui
assessments.lessons_learned: Performance dashboards require careful consideration of data visualization - bar charts with dual metrics (count + duration) provide good density. Agent efficiency scoring with weighted quality metrics enables meaningful leaderboard comparisons. WebSocket integration already existed in server.ts, only needed frontend consumption.

assessments.task_title: Refactor memory system to properly save conversations
assessments.lessons_learned: Automatic extraction on session end needs to be lightweight to avoid blocking. Extracting tool patterns (most used, slow, error-prone) provides actionable insights. Having both quiet (summarize-current) and verbose (summarize) modes enables both automated and manual use. Documentation of active vs deprecated tools is essential for maintainability.

assessments.task_title: Deep Codebase Analysis and Documentation
assessments.lessons_learned: Created comprehensive shared utilities module that will prevent future code duplication. Migration pattern established: 1) Create shared utils first without touching existing code, 2) Migrate low-risk tools first, 3) Migrate high-usage tools last with thorough testing.

assessments.task_title: Improve OpenCode conversation tracking integration
assessments.lessons_learned: OpenCode stores sessions in ~/.local/share/opencode/storage with session/message/part structure. Enhanced sync captures tool patterns, topics, and file changes. Incremental sync prevents reprocessing. Learn command extracts knowledge from conversations.

assessments.task_title: Analyze and customize OpenCode source code
assessments.lessons_learned: OpenCode is highly extensible via plugins. Task tool creates child sessions with restricted permissions. Best integration approach is wrapper tools + system message injection rather than forking.

assessments.task_title: Complete CLI tool migrations to shared utilities
assessments.lessons_learned: Worker agents can efficiently handle repetitive migration tasks. The shared utilities pattern established in session 114 made migrations straightforward - just replace inline functions with imports.

assessments.task_title: Add automated testing for CLI tools
assessments.lessons_learned: Comprehensive unit tests for shared utilities provide confidence in the migration work. 114 tests covering all 4 modules with edge cases like empty strings, invalid JSON, ANSI codes, and boundary conditions. Tests run fast (59ms) with bun test.

assessments.task_title: Apply OpenCode learnings to improve system architecture
assessments.lessons_learned: OpenCode source is well-structured - agents defined in config, plugins can hook into tool execution, session linking via parentID. The task_spawn tool creates better coordination by injecting memory context and task IDs into subagent prompts.

assessments.task_title: Improve automatic knowledge extraction quality
assessments.lessons_learned: Multi-source knowledge extraction is more reliable than regex on conversation text alone. Structured data from message bus task_complete messages, quality assessments lessons_learned, and git commits provides factual information vs inferred learnings.

assessments.task_title: Compact message bus - remove excessive heartbeats
assessments.lessons_learned: Heartbeat frequency can be reduced significantly (30s->60s) without affecting agent health detection. Message bus heartbeats can be sent less frequently than registry updates since coordination messages are the primary use case.

assessments.task_title: Add parent-child session visualization
assessments.lessons_learned: OpenCode stores parentID in session objects allowing easy tree reconstruction. Visual tree formatting with Unicode box-drawing characters ( ) works well in terminals. Grouping by session type using title keywords provides good UX.

assessments.task_title: Refactor dashboard-ui App.tsx into components
assessments.lessons_learned: Breaking large React components into smaller, focused components improves maintainability. Creating a shared types.ts file prevents circular dependencies. Barrel exports (index.ts) simplify imports. The 62% reduction in App.tsx lines makes the codebase much more navigable.

assessments.task_title: Add recharts visualization library to dashboard
assessments.lessons_learned: Recharts integrates well with React TypeScript projects. Creating separate chart components in a charts/ subdirectory keeps the code organized. Color-coding data by thresholds (green/amber/red) provides instant visual feedback. Sparklines are excellent for showing trends in compact spaces.

assessments.task_title: Consolidate conversation-tracker and opencode-tracker
assessments.lessons_learned: When consolidating tools, sometimes deprecation with clear migration guides is better than immediate deletion. This allows gradual migration and preserves backward compatibility. The deprecated tool can be removed in a future cleanup if needed.

assessments.task_title: Clean up unused tools and optimize token usage
assessments.lessons_learned: Tool usage analysis from tool-timing.jsonl provides valuable insights. High-usage tools (read, edit, agent_*, task_*) should remain in plugin. Low-usage tools like task_spawn and recovery tools could move to CLI to reduce token cost.

assessments.task_title: Enhance terminal dashboard with full agent/message viewing
assessments.lessons_learned: Terminal dashboards with blessed work well for TUI. Modular data.ts layer makes adding features easier. Task management through dialogs is more user-friendly than raw commands.

assessments.task_title: Track token usage in OpenCode sessions
assessments.lessons_learned: Token data is stored per-message in OpenCode's storage. Cache read/write tracking is valuable for cost analysis. The CLI dashboard pattern works well for terminal-focused users.

assessments.task_title: Dashboard: Show messages for selected OpenCode session
assessments.lessons_learned: Worker successfully implemented full-stack feature: API endpoints + React component with proper types. Good pattern for future dashboard features.
